alert.note: Alert for Dakota; Dixon (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued April 30 at 10:24AM CDT until April 30 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Northwest winds 25 to 40 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. Isolated higher gusts are possible through early afternoon. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and west central Iowa, southwest Minnesota, northeast Nebraska and east central and southeast South Dakota. * WHEN...Until 8 PM CDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong northwest winds, coupled with low relative humidity values along and east of the Interstate 29 corridor, will create elevated fire danger conditions. Please follow the necessary safety precautions if you are planning any outdoor activities.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.
